edu.umaryland.igs.idea
Class IDEAInputGUI

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      edu.umaryland.igs.idea.IDEAInputGUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible, RootPaneContainer, WindowConstants
public class IDEAInputGUI
extends JFrame

IDEAInputGUI is the main class in the IDEA suite, which is designed to allow users to perform analyses of molecular evolution and view their results. When it is invoked via the "idea" Perl wrapper, a display allowing the user either to run a new analysis or to view existing results (via IDEAOutputGUI) is brought up. When running a new analysis, the user may input parameters to the underlying analysis programs, run the programs and monitor their progress. The underlying programs are executed using the Workflow system. Much of the code governing the display is in classes Parameter and ParameterSet.

Written:

Copyright (C) 2006, Amy Egan and Joana C. Silva.

All rights reserved.

Author:
Amy Egan
See Also:

Constructor Detail

IDEAInputGUI

private IDEAInputGUI(String gnlFilename,
                     String cFilename)
This creates a new IDEAInputGUI instance, sets the filename for the dataset name list, loads the configuration from the supplied file and brings up the first page of the display.

Parameters:
gnlFilename - the name of the file containing the list of dataset names
cFilename - the name of the configuration file

IDEAInputGUI

IDEAInputGUI()
This convenience constructor creates an IDEAInputGUI with no starting dataset name list and the default control file.

Method Detail

loadConfiguration

private void loadConfiguration(JFrame owner,
                               String programString)
This loadConfiguration method loads the configuration from the current control filename. It handles any checked exceptions.

Parameters:
owner - the window from which this method was called
programString - the value of the "PAML program" parameter (baseml or codeml) before loading the configuration

saveConfiguration

private void saveConfiguration(JFrame owner)
This saveConfiguration method saves the configuration to the current control filename. It handles any checked exceptions.

Parameters:
owner - the window from which this method was called

initialize

private void initialize()
This adds a window-closing listener and then brings up the first display page.

showSecondPage

private void showSecondPage()
This brings up the second display page, which contains the configuration panel. The second page is represented by this, an IDEAInputGUI that extends JFrame.

showIntroPage

private void showIntroPage()
This brings up the intro page, which allows the user to choose to start a new analyis or view previous results. The IDEA logo is displayed in the background. The first page is represented by a local JFrame object.

showFollowUpPage

private void showFollowUpPage()
This brings up a page which allows the user to select a PAML program (codeml or baseml). The follow-up page is represented by a local JFrame object.

showFirstPage

private void showFirstPage()
This brings up the first page, which allows the user to select the running mode and input/output options. The first page is represented by a local JFrame object.

This creates and returns the menu bar. The actions to take in response to menu-option selections are specified here.

Parameters:
owner - the frame with which this menu bar is associated
Returns:
the menu bar

                             throws IOException

IOException

private String getInstanceFilename()
The getInstanceFilename method returns the member variable.

setSaveException

private void setSaveException(IOException ioe)
The setSaveException method records the exception thrown by the engine-running thread.

Parameters:
ioe - the exception thrown by the engine-running thread

setIDEAStatus

void setIDEAStatus(IDEAInputGUI.Status status)
The setIDEAStatus method is called by the engine-running thread when IDEA starts or finishes (whether it succeeds or fails). It should not be called from the event-dispatching thread.

Parameters:
status - IDEA's status

startIDEA

private String startIDEA()
                  throws IOException
The startIDEA method prepares the files necessary for the analysis process and then starts it.

Returns:
the name of the instance file for the workflow
Throws:
IOException

prepareWorkflow

protected String prepareWorkflow()
                          throws IOException
The prepareWorkflow method creates files necessary to run Workflow, which runs the underlying analysis scripts. These files are created by fleshing out templates with user-specified customizations.

Returns:
the name of the instance file for the workflow
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs

createINIFiles

private void createINIFiles(String datasetNameList,
                            String outputDir,
                            String workflowDir)
                     throws IOException
This subroutine for prepareWorkflow creates the INI files necessary for running Workflow. In addition to the top-level INI file, a subflow INI files is created for each dataset.

Parameters:
datasetNameList - the name of the file listing datasets
outputDir - the name of the output directory
workflowDir - the name of the workflow subdirectory under the output directory
Throws:
IOException

validateOptions

public static void validateOptions(Map options)
                            throws IllegalArgumentException
NOTE: The command-line option interface is currently unadvertised and unsupported. It is retained in the code in case it is useful for developing the upcoming text-based interface. Currently, users are expected to invoke "idea" with no arguments. The validateOptions method validates the options passed in the options hashtable. Although this method has public visibility it should not be used directly. The method has been exposed only for unit testing.

Parameters:
options - a HashMap containing all the options passed as parameters
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException

main

public static void main(String[] args)
This is the entry point to the Java portion of IDEA. Code for processing command-line options is retained, but they aren't currently supported.

Parameters:
args - the command-line arguments with which this class was invoked
